dt-type.name: object
dt-type.description:
JavaScript's native `Object` type is used to create sets of information, containing data of any JavaScript data type. Objects are created using: `{}` or `new Object()`.
A detailed description of the `Array` type is available on the [Mozilla Developer Network](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Array).
## Use in DataTables
Where a parameter is shown as accepting an object type, or a method returning an object type, it indicates that a native `object` is expected / returned.
Note that typically the objects used by DataTables will be of the _plain object_ (`{}`) variety, particularly when working with data sets to display in the table, however, JavaScript also treats object instances created by the `new` keyword as objects. DataTables will also accept object instances where `object` is shown as the data type.
